resources.string: 1. What does the pwd command do?
2. What is the difference in the > and >> operators?
> appends the standard output to a file, >> appends the standard error to a file.
>> appends the standard output to a file, > appends the standard error to a file.
> Overwrites a file or creates a new one, >> appends a file or creates a new one.
>> Overwrites a file or creates a new one, > appends a file or creates a new one.
3. apt-get update does what on a Debian based system?
Information of the latest update is returned.
All available updates are downloaded and installed.
All available updates are downloaded so that you can install them later.
update is an invalid option for apt-get
4. Which of these commands will update the htop program on a RedHat based system? (choose two)
5. What does the top command do
Displays the "top" of a text file.
Displays a dynamic list of processes ordered according to their CPU use.
Returns the name of a parent program.
Nothing. top is an invalid command.
6. What type of partition does Linux use as an extension of memory?
7. What is the purpose of udev?
To upgrade drivers for a device.
8. A new Linux computer with a single SATA hard drive will assign what device identifier to the drive?
9. What do you type to switch to insert mode from Vi\'s command mode?
